DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure G-Banding Cytogenetics Positive Finding Performed Comments Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Free text field for general notes for positive information related to a procedure of studying disease states by use of Giemsa stain to produce a characteristic staining pattern on chromosomes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure G-Banding Cytogenetics Positive Finding Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Use of Giemsa stain to produce a characteristic staining pattern on chromosomes_The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities._A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Use of Giemsa stain to produce a characteristic staining pattern on chromosomes:The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.:A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Use of Giemsa stain to produce a characteristic staining pattern on chromosomes
The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field for general notes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
